title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.10 | 02-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानाञ्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गवरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवासादी गवरभक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा राम रामा हरे हरे
ओम नमो भगवते वासु देवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चैवनरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासं ततो जयमुदीरयेत
In this session we will be discussing from the 10th verse of the 15th chapter of the 1st Canto Srimad Bhagavatam
पत्न्यास्तवाधी मख त्लिप्त महाविषेक श्लागिष्ठ चारु कबरं कितवै सभायां स्पृष्टं विकीरिय पदयो पतिताश्रु मुख्या यस्तत्स्त्रियो अक्रत हतेश विमुक्त केशा
The meaning of this verse is
It was he only who loosened the hair of all the women
The wives of the miscreants
Who dared open the cluster of your queen's hair
Which had been nicely dressed and sanctified
For the great Rajasuya sacrificial ceremony
At that time she fell down at the feet of Lord Krishna
With tears in her eyes
So this is an incident that happened
Before the Pandavas went
To the temple of Lord Krishna
To the forest for exile
In the gambling match something happened
That is described by Prabhupada
In the purport
Queen Draupadi had a beautiful bunch of hair
Which was sanctified in the ceremonial function of Rajasuya Yajna
The Rajasuya Yajna took place before the Pandavas went to exile
So Draupadi was actually
Sanctified in that ceremonial function
She had a very beautiful bunch of hair
But when she was lost in a bet
During the gambling match
Between the Pandavas and Kauravas
Dushasana touched her glorified hair to insult her
These are demoniac natured people
They have no consideration that
A chaste lady is never to be insulted by the Pandavas
A chaste lady is never to be insulted by the Pandavas
So they thought they can do whatever they like
And get away with it
So Dushasana actually insulted Draupadi
Draupadi then fell down at the lotus feet of Lord Krishna
And Lord Krishna decided
That all the wives of Dushasana and company
Should have their hair loosened
As a result of the banal activity of the Pandavas

the battle of Kurukshetra. Thus, after the battle of Kurukshetra, after all the sons and grandsons of Dhritarashtra died in battle, all the wives of the family were obliged to loosen their hair as widows. You see, all the wives of the Kuru family became widows because of Dushasana

insulting a great devotee of the Lord. So here is another very very important lesson for all of us. It is explained by Srila Prabhupada. The Lord can tolerate insults upon himself by any miscreant because the father tolerates even insults from the son. But the Lord never tolerates insults from the son.

The Lord never tolerates insults upon his devotees. If someone insults Krishna, Krishna may tolerate. But if someone insults Krishna's devotees, Krishna will never tolerate. And it is explained here, by insulting a great soul, one has to forego all the results of pious acts and benedictions also.
So Dushasana, by insulting Draupadi, the chaste.

The chaste lady and pure devotee of Krishna invited trouble for himself. So all the Kauravas, all the sons of Dhritarashtra and his grandsons, were all killed in the battle of Kurukshetra. None of them survived. Not even one surviving descendant for Dhritarashtra. Not even one surviving descendant.
And the Pandavas, they were actually killed.

They were actually protected by Krishna mystically, that they were completely unharmed in that big battle. It was a world war. It was no small battle. It was the world war. And in that the Pandavas were protected by Krishna.

So, the lesson for us is never insult a Vaishnava. Never offend a Vaishnava. It is very dangerous. By offending a Vaishnava, one loses all results of the pious activities and all benedictions also are lost.
There is another incident described in the

Chaitanya Charita Amrita, in the life of Srila Haridas Thakur. Haridas Thakur was a devotee of Lord Chaitanya. And he used to chant the Hare Krishna mantra himself very nicely. And he also preached to people on the order of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. He used to preach others.
Also to take up this chanting of Hare Krishna mantra.
He is described as the ideal devotee who not only practices very nicely the Krishna conscious principles, especially chanting, he also preaches on the order of the Lord. So, he is the ideal devotee.
Sanatana Goswami glorifies Haridas Thakur as
It is Haridasa Thakur whose ideal devotee, because while there are some devotees who practice very nicely but don't preach, and there are others who preach very nicely but don't practice adequately,

Haridasa Thakur is a unique devotee who nicely practices and preaches about the chanting of the holy name. So he is the ideal, perfect devotee. This is the way Haridasa Thakur is glorified by Sanatana Goswami.
So Haridasa Thakur was once insulted by a priest.

And that is described in the Chaitanya Charita Amrita that in the house of two governmental treasurers called Hiranya Majumdar and Govardhana Majumdar, there was a meeting because they were devotees of Krishna.
So there was a meeting of two devotees.
And there was a meeting of saintly persons.
So in that meeting, one Balaram Acharya, who was a priest of this Majumdar household, that Balaram Acharya was invited for the meeting of saintly persons in Majumdar's house.
And Balaram Acharya, he had...
brought to that meeting Haridasa Thakur.
also.
So Haridasa Thakur he was...
traveling and preaching and while traveling and preaching, he happened to come to this village,
where these two brothers, treasurers, of the government were staying Hiranya Majumdar and Govardhana Majumdar.
So when he came to that meeting.
that village he accepted prasadam in the house of Balaramacharya and he used to perform chanting
in a solitary place where there was a thatched hut. Living in a simple hut he would chant
practically the whole day and take a little prasadam from Balaramacharya's residence.
So in that meeting there were discourses taking place and the saintly persons participated
in that discourse. So when Haridasa Thakur was invited to come to that assembly in which
the discourses were to take place.
Haridasa Thakur was invited to come to that assembly in which the discourses were to take place.
Haridasa Thakur accompanied by Balaramacharya came to the house of the Majumdars.
So when all the devotees particularly these two Majumdars they saw Haridasa Thakur they
immediately stood up to receive him with great respect and they fell at his lotus feet and
they gave him a nice place to sit.
In that assembly were many people.
Many learned scholars, brahmanas and respectable gentlemen.
In fact these two brothers Hiranya and Govardhan Majumdar were also very learned.
So everyone began to speak of Haridasa Thakur's great qualities.
So the brothers were very happy to hear everyone glorifying Haridasa Thakur.
So it was mentioned that Haridasa Thakur used to chant three lakh names of Krishna every day.
Practically, he would chant the whole day.
And the scholars began to discuss the glories of chanting the holy name.
Some of them said by chanting the holy name one is freed from all reactions of sinful
life.
Then somebody else said by chanting the holy name one is liberated from material bondage.
Haridasa Thakur, however, said that if you chant the holy name, you will be freed from
material bondage.
Haridasa Thakur said that if you chant the holy name you will be free from material bondage.
These two benedictions are not the true result of chanting the holy name.
Actually, by chanting the holy name without offences, one awakens his ecstatic love for the lotus feet of Krishna.
Actually, it is described in the scriptures.
Chanting of the holy name, offenselessly, awakens the dormant devotion and one becomes a lover of God, Krishna.
Now, as regards liberation and becoming free from sinful reactions are concerned,
they are insignificant by-products of chanting the holy name.
The holy name of the Supreme Lord.
Insignificant by-products.
Now, Haridasa Thakur gives an example to help us understand.
Just like, when the sun rises, it dissipates the world's darkness immediately.
So, similarly,
when one chants the holy name of the Supreme Lord,
without offences,
automatically all the sinful reactions are completely eradicated.
Now, Srila Haridasa Thakur explains that
even before the sun rises,
there is some first glimpse of sunlight that appears before the sun rises,
and even with the first glimpse of this sunlight,
the fear of thieves, ghosts, demons, immediately disappears.
And when the sun actually rises,
everything is manifest and everyone begins performing his religious activities and material duties.
So, similarly,
at the first hint that somebody is chanting offenselessly the holy name of the Supreme Lord,
immediately all reactions to sinful life are completely eradicated.
So, when actually one chants the holy name offenselessly,
one becomes ecstatic
in love of Krishna.
So, Haridasa Thakur explains that
even before one becomes a pure chanter of the holy name,
even before that,
just by a glimpse of offenseless chanting,
immediately all sinful reactions are completely nullified.
So, liberation is actually an insignificant thing for a pure devotee.
So, when one particular brahmana,
Gopal Chakravarthy,
who was the official chief tax collector in that village,
he heard this, he became very upset.
He said,
he had a beautiful body,
very nice handsome features,
and he began to
criticize Haridasa Thakur.
He said,
look at this emotional devotee saying that
liberation is very easily obtained by a glimpse of
offenseless chanting of the holy name of the Supreme Lord.
Liberation is so difficult.
It takes millions of births.
When one is perfectly situated in absolute knowledge,
only then one may attain liberation.
But here is the sentimental person who says
very easily you can get liberation.
So, then Haridasa Thakur said,
why are you doubting the revealed scriptures?
I am just quoting the revealed scriptures.
So, then this brahmana said,
if it is not true,
then I will cut off your nose.
Haridasa Thakur humbly accepted.
If it is not true,
then Haridasa Thakur said,
yes,
you can cut my nose.
But others became very, very upset
at this brahmana Gopal Chakravarthi
insulting Haridasa Thakur.
So, they all protested
and Haridasa Thakur
did not take offense and left that place.
But very soon,
in three days,
this brahmana,
he got leprosy
and his nose was affected
and it fell off.
So, this is the result of offending a pure devotee
that this Gopal Chakravarthi,
he became afflicted by leprosy
and he lost his nose
when he insulted Haridasa Thakur telling,
I will cut off your nose
if what you are telling is not true.
So, we have to be careful
not to insult devotees.
Otherwise, it is very dangerous
for our spiritual life.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
